posts.post_content:
Hi All,

I'm going to dip my big toe in the T206 ocean by starting with Dode Criss.

Why Dode Criss?  Because he shares my birthday (a heartly Thanks! to clydepepper for his [URL="http://www.net54baseball.com/showthread.php?t=204464"]T206 Birthday thread[/URL]). 

I figure a back run will be a fun way to start off!

So if you've got any lyin' around, please let me know.

Thanks, Dave

You may enjoy collecting T206's for years.
It's a long run.

Welcome, Dave.

What are you looking for, condition-wise?  Graded/ungraded?

Email sent.

Thanks for the welcome!

Graded or ungraded is fine.  Lower grade to keep it affordable.  Would really prefer cards that would grade numerically.  Hope that helps,  Dave

Dave, there are a lot of ways in which to collect cards and collection by birth date is one of them.  I don't have a spare Criss, but here is a short list of other early cards you may wish to put on your want list.  All were born March 12th.  Let me know if you would like to see the list extended.

Denny Lyons 1898 Cameo Pepsin Gum Pins

John Beall 1909 Obak

George McAvoy 1912 Zeenuts

Walter Mattick 1916, 1917 Zeenuts

Reb Russell
1914 Cracker Jack
1915 Cracker Jack
1914 Polo Grounds
1916 BF2 Felt Pennants
1916 Sporting News M101-5
1917 Sporting News M101-4
1917 White Sox Team Issue

Bah!  I haven't even purchased my first T206 and you have me looking for other cards! :eek:  


Just kidding, that list is great!  Thank goodness I don't share a birthday with Ruth, Mantle or Gehrig, right? :p

If it's easy, I would love to see the rest of the list.  Otherwise, it'll just be a research assignment for myself. ;)

Thanks for the reply!  Dave

the right thing to collect (T206)......if you have any questions, email me....

I looked for a dode criss, but I traded it away, or I would have just sent it to you.....I would have loved to give you your first T206:)

peace

johnny

OK Dave, below is a list of pre-war cards for players born 3/12.  Unfortunately, I am unable to automate the process so you can dig out the post-war cards yourself if you are so inclined.

Bill James was a bit of a challenge as there were 2 players by that name playing at the same time (and both included in the Zeenuts series).  I weeded out the imposter and I believe the cards I list are all for William Lawrence James ("Seattle Bill").  The Beckett Baseball Card Alphabetical Checklist was of no help as it co-mingles the two players under one name.  Fortunately, I have a good Zeenut resource.

George Maisel
1917 Zeenuts
1919 Zeenuts
1920 Zeenuts
1921 Exhibits

William Lawrence James
1915 Cracker Jack
1916 BF2 Felt Pennants
1916 Sporting News M101-5
1917 Collins-McCarthy E135
1917 Sporting News M101-4
1917 Standard Biscuit
1924 Zeenuts
1925 Zeenuts

Alexander Gaston
1921 E121 Series of 120
1921 E121 Series of 80
1921 Koester's Bread World Series Issue D383
1922 W501
1922 W575

Bud Tinning (Lyle)
1932 Cubs Team Issue
1932 Orbit Gum Pins "Numbered"
1932 Orbit Gum Pins "Unumbered"
1933 Tatoo Orbit R305
1934 Diamond Match Co. Silver Border
1934 Goudey R320

Note:  I did not try to research all the advertising back variations for certain issues.
Outstanding!  Thank you so much for taking the time to research and reply!  Great stuff!  Great people on these boards!

Thanks!  I cannot believe how helpful you guys are.  

It's on my watch list now :)

anytime my friend.....this has great eye appeal.....back slightly tufer....

[url]http://www.ebay.com/itm/T206-DODE-CRISS-G-VG-ST-LOUIS-AMER-SWEET-CAPORAL-BACK-W-ERASED-INK-CREASED-/310583177093?pt=LH_DefaultDomain_0&hash=item4850332f85[/url]


offer a $20.00 bill shipped and I think this maybe a decent deal for you.....but try to snipe the one in the previous lot cheap and you will feel really good if you get it under 20 bux....

if you want, email me anytime, I will scope out any T206 for you:)
